info.title: EasyTrans Documentation
info.description: Base URL : https://www.mytrans.nl/demo/api Welcome to the EasyTrans REST API documentation! REST API to communicate with the EasyTrans Transport Management System. This documentation explains the various endpoints that are available. As you scroll down, you will see code examples for working with the API in different programming languages. Every EasyTrans account has its own URL and therefore also its own API base URL. The API URL is made up out of the following parts: https://www.YOUR_SERVER/YOUR_ENVIRONMENT/api/v1/ Please make sure that you have the correct URL of your carrier when you start making requests. If you are unsure which URL to use, please contact EasyTrans Software. Please note: The REST API is not active by default. A request for activation can be done by sending an e-mail to the address in the Contact section below. Non-backward compatible API changes will result in a new v2 URL, which will lead to updated API documentation. For now, only /api/v1/ is active. New and updated functionality in this API version can be found in the Changelog below. The EasyTrans API is only accessible through HTTPS and requests and responses are always JSON formatted. This API is written for three types of users: 1. EasyTrans users (branch accounts) Branch accounts are mainly used to connect EasyTrans to other systems that the carrier uses, such as CRM or WMS software, or a customized Web Portal. 2. The customers of EasyTrans users (customer accounts) Customer accounts are generally used to connect Web shops, ERP systems or any other software that the carrier’s customer uses. 3. The carriers of EasyTrans users (carrier accounts) Carrier accounts are used by the final party that carries out the transport. A carrier account is generally used to provide updates about the status of an order. Some methods and data are only available to specific accounts, such as customer data or order updates by carrier. A maximum of 60 requests per minute is allowed. A 429 Too Many Requests response will be given if the amount is exceeded. The EasyTrans API is a work in progress. We add new functionality based on the needs of our customers. Is information currently missing or do you need certain functionality that is not yet available? Please contact us to discuss the possibilities. Contact For more information about our API, you can contact EasyTrans via: Netherlands/Belgium: www.easytrans.nl - info@easytrans.nl United Kingdom: www.easytrans.co.uk - info@easytrans.co.uk php

endpoints.description: This endpoint returns all orders for the authenticated customer or branch account. The result can be filtered by the filter options below. A combination of filters is also allowed. For some filters you can filter on multiple values by separating them with a comma. For example: ?filter[orderNo]=1,2,3 You can also use the following operators on any integer or date type filter, by placing them behind the name of the filter: [gte] = Greater than or equal [gt] = Greater than [lte] = Less than or equal [lt] = Less than [neq] = Not equal For example: ?filter[date][gte]=2023-12-01 returns all orders with an order date starting from this date. Operators can also be combined. For example: ?filter[orderNo][gte]=1000&filter[orderNo][lt]=2000 returns all orders between 1000 and 1999. The result can be sorted by the sort names below. The result is paginated by 100 orders.

query_parameters.name: filter
query_parameters.description: Fields to filter by

query_parameters.name: filter.orderNo
query_parameters.description: Filter by order number. Multiple orders can be retrieved by separating the order numbers with a comma or by using operators. Use the [gte] operator to retrieve all orders starting from this order number ?filter[orderNo][gte]=1234 .

query_parameters.name: filter.date
query_parameters.description: Filter by order date. Use the [gte] operator to retrieve all orders starting from this date ?filter[date][gte]=2023-12-01 .

query_parameters.name: filter.createdAt
query_parameters.description: Filter by created at timestamp. Use the [gte] operator to retrieve all orders that where created since this timestamp ?filter[createdAt][gte]=2023-12-01T10:05:01 .

query_parameters.name: filter.updatedAt
query_parameters.description: Filter by updated at timestamp. Use the [gte] operator to retrieve all orders that where last updated since this timestamp ?filter[updatedAt][gte]=2023-12-01T10:05:01 .

query_parameters.name: filter.status
query_parameters.description: Filter by order status. Possible values for customer accounts are: quote, saved-weborder, pending-acceptation, in-progress, finished. Possible values for branch accounts are: quote, saved-weborder, pending-acceptation, open, planned, signed-off, checked, invoiced. Multiple statuses can be retrieved by separating the statuses with a comma ?filter[status]=quote,saved-weborder .

query_parameters.name: filter.substatusNo
query_parameters.description: Filter by order substatus number. Multiple substatus numbers can be retrieved by separating the numbers with a comma or by using operators.

query_parameters.name: filter.customerReference
query_parameters.description: Filter by the customer reference field from the order destinations.

query_parameters.name: filter.productNo
query_parameters.description: Filter by product number. Multiple product numbers can be retrieved by separating the numbers with a comma or by using operators.

query_parameters.name: filter.vehicleTypeNo
query_parameters.description: Filter by vehicle type number. Multiple vehicle type numbers can be retrieved by separating the numbers with a comma or by using operators.

query_parameters.name: filter.waybillNotes
query_parameters.description: Filter by any part of text from the notes on the waybill.

query_parameters.name: filter.invoiceNotes
query_parameters.description: Filter by any part of text from the notes on the invoice.

query_parameters.name: filter.customerNo
query_parameters.description: Filter by customer number (only with branch account). Multiple customer numbers can be retrieved by separating the numbers with a comma or by using operators.

query_parameters.name: filter.carrierNo
query_parameters.description: Filter by carrier number (only with branch account). Multiple carrier numbers can be retrieved by separating the numbers with a comma or by using operators.

query_parameters.name: filter.fleetNo
query_parameters.description: Filter by fleet number (only with branch account). Multiple fleet numbers can be retrieved by separating the numbers with a comma or by using operators.

query_parameters.name: filter.invoiceId
query_parameters.description: Filter by invoice Id. The invoice Id is an internal number that can be used to retrieve the orders that correspond to an invoice. Multiple invoice Id's can be retrieved by separating the invoice Id with a comma or by using operators.

query_parameters.name: filter.externalId
query_parameters.description: Filter by external Id. Multiple orders can be retrieved by separating the values with a comma or by using operators (only when numeric).

query_parameters.name: sort
query_parameters.description: Sort the response. The result can be sorted by the following property names: orderNo, date (also includes time), createdAt, updatedAt, status, substatusNo, productNo, vehicleTypeNo, waybillNotes, invoiceNotes, invoiceId, externalId. Additionally, a branch account can also sort by: customerNo, carrierNo, fleetNo. Sorting is ascending by default and can be reversed by adding a hyphen (-) to the start of the property name. You can sort by multiple properties by separating them with a comma ?sort=status,-date .

query_parameters.name: include_customer
query_parameters.description: If true, returns the customer details.

query_parameters.name: include_carrier
query_parameters.description: If true, returns the carrier details (only with branch account).

query_parameters.name: include_track_history
query_parameters.description: If true, returns an array with the available order Track & Trace history.

query_parameters.name: include_sales_rates
query_parameters.description: If true, returns an array with the sales rates.

query_parameters.name: include_purchase_rates
query_parameters.description: If true, returns an array with the purchase rates (only with branch account).

query_parameters.name: include_deleted
query_parameters.description: If true, also returns orders that have been marked as deleted, with an additional isDeleted attribute (only with branch account).

response_fields.name: createdAt
response_fields.description: Order creation timestamp in ISO 8601 date format.

response_fields.name: updatedAt
response_fields.description: Order last updated timestamp in ISO 8601 date format.

response_fields.name: date
response_fields.description: Order date. Date on which the order needs to be performed. Usually the date on which the carrier needs to be at the pickup address. Dates are in the form ‘yyyy-mm-dd’.

response_fields.name: time
response_fields.description: Order time. Time on which the order starts. This is usually the time on which the carrier needs to arrive at the pickup address. Times are in the form ‘hh:mm’ and are local time.

response_fields.name: status
response_fields.description: Order status. For customer accounts, the options are: - quote - saved-weborder (not yet send to the planning) - pending-acceptation (send to the planning but not yet accepted) - in-progress - finished For branch accounts, the options are: - quote - saved-weborder (not yet send to the planning) - pending-acceptation (send to the planning but not yet accepted) - open - planned - signed-off - checked - invoiced

response_fields.name: substatusName
response_fields.description: Optional extra order status, such as ‘Delivered at the neighbours’.

response_fields.name: collected
response_fields.description: Indicates the driver has picked-up the goods (goods on board).

response_fields.name: distance
response_fields.description: Distance in kilometres for EU or miles for UK.

response_fields.name: trackingId
response_fields.description: Contains the Track & Trace number used to track the actual order status. A Track & Trace link can be generated by using the trackingId in the following URL format: https://www.YOUR_SERVER/YOUR_ENVIRONMENT/tracktrace.php?trackingnr=trackingId

response_fields.name: userId,carrierNo,carrierUserId,fleetNo,orderPurchasePrice,purchaseInvoiceNotes,internalNotes,carrierNotes,readyForPurchaseInvoice,usernameCreated,usernameAssigned
response_fields.description: Only visible with branch accounts.

goods.description: Describe the contents of the box.

attributes.crmNotes: Agreed rates based on 50 orders per month

endpoints.description: This endpoint returns the specified order for the authenticated customer or branch.

response_fields.name: createdAt

response_fields.name: updatedAt
response_fields.description: Order last updated timestamp in ISO 8601 date format.

response_fields.name: date

response_fields.name: time
response_fields.description: Order time. Time on which the order starts. This is usually the time on which the carrier needs to arrive at the pickup address. Times are in the form ‘hh:mm’ and are local time.

response_fields.name: status
response_fields.description: Order status. For customer accounts, the options are: - quote - saved-weborder (not yet send to the planning) - pending-acceptation (send to the planning but not yet accepted) - in-progress - finished For branch accounts, the options are: - quote - saved-weborder (not yet send to the planning) - pending-acceptation (send to the planning but not yet accepted) - open - planned - signed-off - checked - invoiced

response_fields.name: substatusName
response_fields.description: Optional extra order status, such as ‘Delivered at the neighbours’.

response_fields.name: collected

response_fields.name: distance

response_fields.name: trackingId
response_fields.description: Contains the Track & Trace number used to track the actual order status. A Track & Trace link can be generated by using the trackingId in the following URL format: https://www.YOUR_SERVER/YOUR_ENVIRONMENT/tracktrace.php?trackingnr=trackingId

response_fields.name: userId,carrierNo,carrierUserId,fleetNo,orderPurchasePrice,purchaseInvoiceNotes,internalNotes,carrierNotes,readyForPurchaseInvoice,usernameCreated,usernameAssigned
response_fields.description: Only visible with branch accounts.

attributes.crmNotes: Agreed rates based on 50 orders per month

endpoints.description: This endpoint updates the specified order and its destinations, goods and rates for the authenticated branch. This endpoint can only be used with branch accounts, not with customer accounts. Only the body parameters below can be updated. Some elements can only be updated if the order is open for editing (not checked or invoiced). The response contains the updated order. Update destinations, goods and rates A destination can be updated by providing the addressId (or stopNo) together with the body parameters that need to be changed. A goods line can be updated by providing the packageId (or packageNo) together with the body parameters that need to be changed. Sales and purchase rates can be updated by providing the rateNo and the ratePerUnit. The destinations, goods and rates properties expect an array. This allows updating of multiple destinations/goods/rates in one request. See the example request, how to edit a destination, goods line or rate.

body_parameters.name: carrierNo
body_parameters.description: Sets the new carrier for this order. Supplying 0 removes the carrier. The order status and substatus will be updated accordingly (e.g. open -> planned).

body_parameters.name: fleetNo
body_parameters.description: Sets the new vehicle in the fleet for this order. Please note: Any vehicle type specific rates will not be updated.

body_parameters.name: waybillNotes
body_parameters.description: Notes that are displayed on the transport documents. Updating this field will delete any existing waybill notes.

body_parameters.name: invoiceNotes
body_parameters.description: Notes that are displayed on the sales invoice. Updating this field will delete any existing invoice notes.

body_parameters.name: purchaseInvoiceNotes
body_parameters.description: Notes that are displayed on the purchase invoice. Updating this field will delete any existing purchase invoice notes.

body_parameters.name: internalNotes
body_parameters.description: Notes that are only internally visible (not visible for customers and carriers). Updating this field will delete any existing internal notes.

body_parameters.name: readyForPurchaseInvoice
body_parameters.description: Marks the order as ready to create a purchase invoice.

body_parameters.name: externalId
body_parameters.description: Value (string or numeric, max 50 characters) that can be used to reference an order to the corresponding data in an external system. Must not be greater than 50 characters.

goods.description: Describe the contents of the box.

endpoints.description: This endpoint returns all products for the authenticated customer or branch account. The result can be filtered by product name. For example: ?filter[productName]=Transport

query_parameters.name: filter
query_parameters.description: Fields to filter by

query_parameters.name: filter.productName
query_parameters.description: Filter by (part of) the product name.

query_parameters.name: include_deleted
query_parameters.description: If true, also returns products that have been marked as deleted, with an additional isDeleted attribute (only with branch account).

response_fields.name: vat
response_fields.description: Options are: high, low, zero, none.

endpoints.description: This endpoint returns the specified product for the authenticated customer or branch.

query_parameters.name: include_deleted
query_parameters.description: If true, also returns the product if it has been marked as deleted, with an additional isDeleted attribute (only with branch account).

response_fields.name: vat
response_fields.description: Options are: high, low, zero, none.

endpoints.description: This endpoint returns all substatuses for the authenticated customer or branch account. The result can be filtered by substatus name. For example: ?filter[substatusName]=Depot

query_parameters.name: filter
query_parameters.description: Fields to filter by

query_parameters.name: filter.substatusName
query_parameters.description: Filter by (part of) the substatus name.

query_parameters.name: include_deleted
query_parameters.description: If true, also returns substatuses that have been marked as deleted, with an additional isDeleted attribute (only with branch account).

endpoints.description: This endpoint returns the specified substatus for the authenticated customer or branch.

query_parameters.name: include_deleted
query_parameters.description: If true, also returns the substatus if it has been marked as deleted, with an additional isDeleted attribute (only with branch account).

endpoints.description: This endpoint returns all package types for the authenticated customer or branch account. Package types (also called Rate types) are used to specify the type of goods to be transported. They are also used as Rate types to calculate the price. The result can be filtered by package type name. For example: ?filter[packageTypeName]=Europallet

query_parameters.name: filter
query_parameters.description: Fields to filter by

query_parameters.name: filter.packageTypeName
query_parameters.description: Filter by (part of) the package type name.

query_parameters.name: include_deleted
query_parameters.description: If true, also returns package types that have been marked as deleted, with an additional isDeleted attribute (only with branch account).

response_fields.name: rateTypeOnly
response_fields.description: Indicates if the Package type is only used in the rates and not in the goods to be transported. This is used for non-physical goods, such as warehouse storage.

response_fields.name: standardDimensions
response_fields.description: The standard dimensions are automatically filled in when goods are added to an order.

endpoints.summary: Get package type by package type number
endpoints.description: This endpoint returns the specified package type for the authenticated customer or branch. Package types (also called Rate types) are used to specify the type of goods to be transported. They are also used as Rate types to calculate the price.

query_parameters.name: include_deleted
query_parameters.description: If true, also returns the package type if it has been marked as deleted, with an additional isDeleted attribute (only with branch account).

response_fields.name: rateTypeOnly
response_fields.description: Indicates if the Package type is only used in the rates and not in the goods to be transported. This is used for non-physical goods, such as warehouse storage.

response_fields.name: standardDimensions
response_fields.description: The standard dimensions are automatically filled in when goods are added to an order.

endpoints.description: This endpoint returns all vehicle types for the authenticated customer or branch account. The result can be filtered by vehicle type name. For example: ?filter[vehicleTypeName]=Car

query_parameters.name: filter
query_parameters.description: Fields to filter by

query_parameters.name: filter.vehicleTypeName
query_parameters.description: Filter by (part of) the vehicle type name.

query_parameters.name: include_deleted
query_parameters.description: If true, also returns vehicle types that have been marked as deleted, with an additional isDeleted attribute (only with branch account).

endpoints.summary: Get vehicle type by vehicle type number
endpoints.description: This endpoint returns the specified vehicle type for the authenticated customer or branch.

query_parameters.name: include_deleted
query_parameters.description: If true, also returns the vehicle type if it has been marked as deleted, with an additional isDeleted attribute (only with branch account).

endpoints.description: This endpoint returns all invoices for the authenticated customer or branch account. The result can be filtered by the filter options below. A combination of filters is also allowed. For some filters you can filter on multiple values by separating them with a comma. For example: ?filter[invoiceNo]=1,2,3 You can also use the following operators on any integer or date type filter, by placing them behind the name of the filter: [gte] = Greater than or equal [gt] = Greater than [lte] = Less than or equal [lt] = Less than [neq] = Not equal For example: ?filter[invoiceDate][gte]=2024-05-30 returns all invoices with an invoice date starting from this date. Operators can also be combined. For example: ?filter[invoiceNo][gte]=1000&filter[invoiceNo][lt]=2000 returns all invoices with and invoice number between 1000 and 1999. The result is paginated by 100 invoices.

query_parameters.name: filter
query_parameters.description: Fields to filter by

query_parameters.name: filter.invoiceId
query_parameters.description: Filter by invoice Id. The invoice Id is an internal number that can be used to retrieve the orders that correspond to an invoice. Multiple invoices can be retrieved by separating the invoice Id with a comma or by using operators. Use the [gte] operator to retrieve all invoices starting from this invoice Id ?filter[invoiceId][gte]=284 .

query_parameters.name: filter.invoiceNo
query_parameters.description: Filter by invoice number. Note: This is the part of the invoice number without the prefix Multiple invoices can be retrieved by separating the invoice numbers with a comma or by using operators. Use the [gte] operator to retrieve all invoices starting from this invoice number ?filter[invoiceNo][gte]=20240123 .

query_parameters.name: filter.invoiceNoPrefix
query_parameters.description: Filter by invoice number prefix. Note: This is the part before the invoice number. Multiple prefixes can be retrieved by separating the values with a comma or by using operators (only when numeric).

query_parameters.name: filter.customerNo
query_parameters.description: Filter by customer number (only with branch account). Multiple customer numbers can be retrieved by separating the numbers with a comma or by using operators.

query_parameters.name: filter.invoiceDate
query_parameters.description: Filter by invoice date. Use the [gte] operator to retrieve all invoices starting from this date ?filter[invoiceDate][gte]=2024-05-30 .

query_parameters.name: include_customer
query_parameters.description: If true, returns the customer details.

query_parameters.name: include_invoice
query_parameters.description: If true, returns the base64 encoded PDF invoice.

response_fields.name: invoiceId
response_fields.description: The invoice Id is an internal number that is used to match orders to invoices.

response_fields.name: paymentMethod,onlinePaymentStatus,discountPercentage,sentDate,paid,paidDate,exported,externalId
response_fields.description: Only visible with branch accounts.

response_fields.name: paymentMethod
response_fields.description: Options are: bank_transfer, cash, direct_debit, online_payment, bank_transfer_or_online_payment, creditcard, factoring or empty string.

response_fields.name: onlinePaymentStatus
response_fields.description: Only in use with additional module Online payment. Options are: paid, expired or empty string.

response_fields.name: sentDate
response_fields.description: The date the invoice has been sent to the customer (via email or to Billit).

response_fields.name: exported
response_fields.description: Whether the invoice has been exported to an accounting package.

attributes.crmNotes: Agreed rates based on 50 orders per month

response_fields.name: invoiceId

response_fields.name: paymentMethod,onlinePaymentStatus,discountPercentage,sentDate,paid,paidDate,exported,externalId

response_fields.name: sentDate

endpoints.summary: Get list of customers (branch accounts only)
endpoints.description: This endpoint returns all customers for the authenticated branch. The result can be filtered by the filter options below. A combination of filters is also allowed. For some filters you can filter on multiple values by separating them with a comma. For example: ?filter[customerNo]=1,2,3 You can also use the following operators on any integer or date type filter, by placing them behind the name of the filter: [gte] = Greater than or equal [gt] = Greater than [lte] = Less than or equal [lt] = Less than [neq] = Not equal For example: ?filter[createdAt][gte]=2023-12-01 returns all customers created since this date. Operators can also be combined. For example: ?filter[customerNo][gte]=1000&filter[customerNo][lt]=2000 returns all customers between 1000 and 1999. The result can be sorted by the sort names below. The result is paginated by 100 customers. This endpoint can only be used with branch accounts, not with customer accounts.

query_parameters.name: filter
query_parameters.description: Fields to filter by

query_parameters.name: filter.customerNo
query_parameters.description: Filter by customer number. Multiple customers can be retrieved by separating the customer numbers with a comma or by using operators. Use the [gte] operator to retrieve all customers starting from this customer number ?filter[customer][gte]=1234 .

query_parameters.name: filter.createdAt
query_parameters.description: Filter by created at timestamp. Use the [gte] operator to retrieve all customers that where created since this timestamp ?filter[createdAt][gte]=2023-12-01T10:05:01 .

query_parameters.name: filter.updatedAt
query_parameters.description: Filter by updated at timestamp. Use the [gte] operator to retrieve all customers that where last updated since this timestamp ?filter[updatedAt][gte]=2023-12-01T10:05:01 .

query_parameters.name: filter.companyName
query_parameters.description: Filter by company name.

query_parameters.name: filter.businessAddress.address
query_parameters.description: Filter by the address field from the business address.

query_parameters.name: filter.businessAddress.postcode
query_parameters.description: Filter by the postcode field from the business address.

query_parameters.name: filter.businessAddress.city
query_parameters.description: Filter by the city field from the business address.

query_parameters.name: filter.mailingAddress.address
query_parameters.description: Filter by the address field from the mailing address.

query_parameters.name: filter.mailingAddress.postcode
query_parameters.description: Filter by the postcode field from the mailing address.

query_parameters.name: filter.mailingAddress.city
query_parameters.description: Filter by the city field from the mailing address.

query_parameters.name: filter.notes
query_parameters.description: Filter by any part of text from the customer notes.

query_parameters.name: filter.crmNotes
query_parameters.description: Filter by any part of text from the customer CRM notes.

query_parameters.name: filter.debtorNo
query_parameters.description: Filter by debtor number. Multiple customers can be retrieved by separating the values with a comma or by using operators (only when numeric).

query_parameters.name: filter.paymentReference
query_parameters.description: Filter by payment reference.

query_parameters.name: filter.vatNo
query_parameters.description: Filter by VAT number.

query_parameters.name: filter.externalId
query_parameters.description: Filter by external Id. Multiple customers can be retrieved by separating the values with a comma or by using operators (only when numeric).

query_parameters.name: filter.contacts.name
query_parameters.description: Filter by the name field from the contacts.

query_parameters.name: filter.contacts.phone
query_parameters.description: Filter by the phone number field from the contacts (characters must be an exact match, including spaces and punctuation marks).

query_parameters.name: filter.contacts.mobile
query_parameters.description: Filter by the mobile number field from the contacts (characters must be an exact match, including spaces and punctuation marks)).

query_parameters.name: filter.contacts.email
query_parameters.description: Filter by the email field from the contacts.

query_parameters.name: filter.contacts.notes
query_parameters.description: Filter by any part of text from the notes field from the contacts.

query_parameters.name: filter.contacts.username
query_parameters.description: Filter by the username field from the contacts.

query_parameters.name: sort
query_parameters.description: Sort the response. The result can be sorted by the following property names: customerNo, createdAt, companyName, debtorNo, externalId. Sorting is ascending by default and can be reversed by adding a hyphen (-) to the start of the property name. You can sort by multiple properties by separating them with a comma ?sort=companyName,-createdAt .

query_parameters.name: include_deleted
query_parameters.description: If true, also returns customers that have been marked as deleted, with an additional isDeleted attribute.

response_fields.name: createdAt
response_fields.description: Customer creation timestamp in ISO 8601 date format.

response_fields.name: updatedAt
response_fields.description: Customer last updated timestamp in ISO 8601 date format.

response_fields.name: salutation
response_fields.description: Salutation. One of the following options: 0: No salutation 1: Mr. 2: Mrs. 3: Attn (for instance reception or warehouse)

response_fields.name: vatLiable
response_fields.description: Customer VAT liable status. True if customer is VAT liable or false if customer is not VAT liable. Check vatLiableCode for the reason a customer is not VAT liable.

response_fields.name: vatLiableCode
response_fields.description: Customer VAT liable code. One of the following options: 0: No, within EU 1: Yes 2: No, outside EU 3: No, fiscal unity

attributes.crmNotes: Agreed rates based on 50 orders per month

endpoints.summary: Get customer by customer number (branch accounts only)
endpoints.description: This endpoint returns the specified customer for the authenticated branch. This endpoint can only be used with branch accounts, not with customer accounts.

query_parameters.name: include_deleted
query_parameters.description: If true, also returns the customer if it has been marked as deleted, with an additional isDeleted attribute.

response_fields.name: createdAt
response_fields.description: Customer creation timestamp in ISO 8601 date format.

response_fields.name: updatedAt
response_fields.description: Customer last updated timestamp in ISO 8601 date format.

response_fields.name: salutation
response_fields.description: Salutation. One of the following options: 0: No salutation 1: Mr. 2: Mrs. 3: Attn (for instance reception or warehouse)

response_fields.name: vatLiable
response_fields.description: Customer VAT liable status. True if customer is VAT liable or false if customer is not VAT liable. Check vatLiableCode for the reason a customer is not VAT liable.

response_fields.name: vatLiableCode
response_fields.description: Customer VAT liable code. One of the following options: 0: No, within EU 1: Yes 2: No, outside EU 3: No, fiscal unity

attributes.crmNotes: Agreed rates based on 50 orders per month

endpoints.summary: Get list of carriers (branch accounts only)
endpoints.description: This endpoint returns all carriers for the authenticated branch. The result can be filtered by the filter options below. A combination of filters is also allowed. For some filters you can filter on multiple values by separating them with a comma. For example: ?filter[carrierNo]=1,2,3 You can also use the following operators on any integer or date type filter, by placing them behind the name of the filter: [gte] = Greater than or equal [gt] = Greater than [lte] = Less than or equal [lt] = Less than [neq] = Not equal For example: ?filter[createdAt][gte]=2023-12-01 returns all carriers created since this date. Operators can also be combined. For example: ?filter[carrierNo][gte]=1000&filter[carrierNo][lt]=2000 returns all carriers between 1000 and 1999. The result can be sorted by the sort names below. The result is paginated by 100 carriers. This endpoint can only be used with main branch accounts.

query_parameters.name: filter
query_parameters.description: Fields to filter by

query_parameters.name: filter.carrierNo
query_parameters.description: Filter by carrier number. Multiple carriers can be retrieved by separating the carrier numbers with a comma or by using operators. Use the [gte] operator to retrieve all carriers starting from this carrier number ?filter[carrier][gte]=1234 .

query_parameters.name: filter.createdAt
query_parameters.description: Filter by created at timestamp. Use the [gte] operator to retrieve all carriers that where created since this timestamp ?filter[createdAt][gte]=2023-12-01T10:05:01 .

query_parameters.name: filter.updatedAt
query_parameters.description: Filter by updated at timestamp. Use the [gte] operator to retrieve all carriers that where last updated since this timestamp ?filter[updatedAt][gte]=2023-12-01T10:05:01 .

query_parameters.name: filter.name
query_parameters.description: Filter by the name of the carrier (either a company name or a persons name).

query_parameters.name: filter.businessAddress.address
query_parameters.description: Filter by the address field from the business address.

query_parameters.name: filter.businessAddress.postcode
query_parameters.description: Filter by the postcode field from the business address.

query_parameters.name: filter.businessAddress.city
query_parameters.description: Filter by the city field from the business address.

query_parameters.name: filter.mailingAddress.address
query_parameters.description: Filter by the address field from the mailing address.

query_parameters.name: filter.mailingAddress.postcode
query_parameters.description: Filter by the postcode field from the mailing address.

query_parameters.name: filter.mailingAddress.city
query_parameters.description: Filter by the city field from the mailing address.

query_parameters.name: filter.phone
query_parameters.description: Filter by phone number (characters must be an exact match, including spaces and punctuation marks).

query_parameters.name: filter.mobile
query_parameters.description: Filter by mobile phone number (characters must be an exact match, including spaces and punctuation marks)).

query_parameters.name: filter.email
query_parameters.description: Filter by email.

query_parameters.name: filter.notes
query_parameters.description: Filter by any part of text from the carrier notes.

query_parameters.name: filter.creditorNo
query_parameters.description: Filter by creditor number. Multiple carriers can be retrieved by separating the values with a comma or by using operators (only when numeric).

query_parameters.name: filter.externalId
query_parameters.description: Filter by external Id. Multiple carriers can be retrieved by separating the values with a comma or by using operators (only when numeric).

query_parameters.name: filter.contacts.name
query_parameters.description: Filter by the name field from the contacts.

query_parameters.name: filter.contacts.phone
query_parameters.description: Filter by the phone number field from the contacts (characters must be an exact match, including spaces and punctuation marks).

query_parameters.name: filter.contacts.mobile
query_parameters.description: Filter by the mobile number field from the contacts (characters must be an exact match, including spaces and punctuation marks)).

query_parameters.name: filter.contacts.email
query_parameters.description: Filter by the email field from the contacts.

query_parameters.name: filter.contacts.notes
query_parameters.description: Filter by any part of text from the notes field from the contacts.

query_parameters.name: filter.contacts.username
query_parameters.description: Filter by the username field from the contacts.

query_parameters.name: sort
query_parameters.description: Sort the response. The result can be sorted by the following property names: carrierNo, createdAt, name, creditorNo, externalId. Sorting is ascending by default and can be reversed by adding a hyphen (-) to the start of the property name. You can sort by multiple properties by separating them with a comma ?sort=name,-createdAt .

query_parameters.name: include_deleted
query_parameters.description: If true, also returns carriers that have been marked as deleted, with an additional isDeleted attribute.

response_fields.name: createdAt
response_fields.description: Carrier creation timestamp in ISO 8601 date format.

response_fields.name: updatedAt
response_fields.description: Carrier last updated timestamp in ISO 8601 date format.

response_fields.name: vatLiable
response_fields.description: Carrier VAT liable status. True if carrier is VAT liable or false if carrier is not VAT liable. Check vatLiableCode for the reason a carrier is not VAT liable.

response_fields.name: vatLiableCode
response_fields.description: Carrier VAT liable code. One of the following options: 0: No, within EU 1: Yes 2: No, outside EU 3: No, small business scheme (KOR) 4: No, fiscal unity

endpoints.summary: Get carrier by carrier number (branch accounts only)
endpoints.description: This endpoint returns the specified carrier for the authenticated branch. This endpoint can only be used with main branch accounts.

query_parameters.name: include_deleted
query_parameters.description: If true, also returns the carrier if it has been marked as deleted, with an additional isDeleted attribute.

response_fields.name: createdAt
response_fields.description: Carrier creation timestamp in ISO 8601 date format.

response_fields.name: updatedAt
response_fields.description: Carrier last updated timestamp in ISO 8601 date format.

response_fields.name: vatLiable
response_fields.description: Carrier VAT liable status. True if carrier is VAT liable or false if carrier is not VAT liable. Check vatLiableCode for the reason a carrier is not VAT liable.

response_fields.name: vatLiableCode
response_fields.description: Carrier VAT liable code. One of the following options: 0: No, within EU 1: Yes 2: No, outside EU 3: No, small business scheme (KOR) 4: No, fiscal unity

endpoints.summary: Get list of vehicles in fleet
endpoints.description: This endpoint returns the fleet. It can only be used with branch accounts. The result can be filtered by registration (license plate). For example: ?filter[registration]=VH-357-V

query_parameters.name: filter
query_parameters.description: Fields to filter by

query_parameters.name: filter.registration
query_parameters.description: Filter by regitration (license plate).

query_parameters.name: include_deleted
query_parameters.description: If true, also returns vehicles that have been marked as deleted, with an additional isDeleted attribute.

endpoints.summary: Get vehicles in fleet by fleet number
endpoints.description: This endpoint returns the specified vehicle for the authenticated branch.

query_parameters.name: include_deleted
query_parameters.description: If true, also returns the vehicle if it has been marked as deleted, with an additional isDeleted attribute.

endpoints.description: This endpoint returns all orders for the authenticated carrier. The result can be filtered by the filter options below. A combination of filters is also allowed. For some filters you can filter on multiple values by separating them with a comma. For example: ?filter[orderNo]=1,2,3 You can also use the following operators on any integer or date type filter, by placing them behind the name of the filter: [gte] = Greater than or equal [gt] = Greater than [lte] = Less than or equal [lt] = Less than [neq] = Not equal For example: ?filter[date][gte]=2023-12-01 returns all orders with an order date starting from this date. Operators can also be combined. For example: ?filter[orderNo][gte]=1000&filter[orderNo][lt]=2000 returns all orders between 1000 and 1999. The result can be sorted by the sort names below. The result is paginated by 100 orders.

query_parameters.name: filter
query_parameters.description: Fields to filter by

query_parameters.name: filter.orderNo
query_parameters.description: Filter by order number. Multiple orders can be retrieved by separating the order numbers with a comma or by using operators. Use the [gte] operator to retrieve all orders starting from this order number ?filter[orderNo][gte]=1234 .

query_parameters.name: filter.date
query_parameters.description: Filter by order date. Use the [gte] operator to retrieve all orders starting from this date ?filter[date][gte]=2023-12-01 .

query_parameters.name: filter.createdAt
query_parameters.description: Filter by created at timestamp. Use the [gte] operator to retrieve all orders that where created since this timestamp ?filter[createdAt][gte]=2023-12-01T10:05:01 .

query_parameters.name: filter.updatedAt
query_parameters.description: Filter by updated at timestamp. Use the [gte] operator to retrieve all orders that where last updated since this timestamp ?filter[updatedAt][gte]=2023-12-01T10:05:01 .

query_parameters.name: filter.status
query_parameters.description: Filter by order status. Possible values for carrier accounts are: in-progress, finished.

query_parameters.name: sort
query_parameters.description: Sort the response. The result can be sorted by the following property names: orderNo, date (also includes time), createdAt, updatedAt, status. Sorting is ascending by default and can be reversed by adding a hyphen (-) to the start of the property name. You can sort by multiple properties by separating them with a comma ?sort=status,-date .

response_fields.name: createdAt
response_fields.description: Order creation timestamp in ISO 8601 date format.

response_fields.name: updatedAt
response_fields.description: Order last updated timestamp in ISO 8601 date format.

response_fields.name: date
response_fields.description: Order date. Date on which the order needs to be performed. Usually the date on which the carrier needs to be at the pickup address. Dates are in the form ‘yyyy-mm-dd’.

response_fields.name: time
response_fields.description: Order time. Time on which the order starts. This is usually the time on which the carrier needs to arrive at the pickup address. Times are in the form ‘hh:mm’ and are local time.

response_fields.name: status
response_fields.description: Order status. The options are: in-progress finished

response_fields.name: substatusName
response_fields.description: Optional extra order status, such as ‘Delivered at the neighbours’.

goods.description: Describe the contents of the box.

response_fields.name: date

response_fields.name: time

response_fields.name: status

response_fields.name: substatusName
response_fields.description: Optional extra order status, such as ‘Delivered at the neighbours’.

endpoints.summary: Update the specified order for a carrier
endpoints.description: This endpoint updates the specified order and its destinations for the authenticated carrier. It is generally used to let a carrier sign-off an order and provide POD information. Only the body parameters below can be updated. Only orders that are open for editing can be updated (finished orders cannot be changed). The response contains the updated order. Update destinations A destination can be updated by providing the addressId (or stopNo) together with the body parameters that need to be changed. For a simple order with only one pickup and one delivery address, stopNo 2 is updated to sign-off an order. StopNo 1 can be updated to inform the carrier the goods have been loaded. For a multi stop order, several destinations need to be updated in order to update the POD information for each location. The destinations property expects an array. This allows updating of multiple destinations in one request. See the example request on how to edit a destination.

body_parameters.name: status
body_parameters.description: Sets the new status for this order. If the transport is finished, but the goods could not be delivered, use the carrierNotes field to specify a undeliverable reason.

goods.description: Describe the contents of the box.
